snippet: Egypt’s antiquities minister has asked the Obama administration for fast action to stop the sales of stolen cultural treasures.
abstract: Egyptian antiquities Min Mohamed Ibrahim Ali is asking Obama administration to impose emergency restrictions on importing of ancient artifacts from his country, saying looting and smuggling of such treasures has been catastrophic since Arab Spring revolt of 2011; State Department says it is open to proposal.
lead_paragraph: Egypt’s antiquities minister has asked the Obama administration for fast action to stop the sales of stolen cultural treasures.

headline.main: Egypt Asks U.S. to Impose Sharp Curbs on Importing of Antiquities
headline.print_headline: Egypt Asks U.S. to Impose Sharp Curbs on Importing of Antiquities
